Quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
Author: Plato

Quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.
Author: Heraclitus

Quote: At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet.
Author: Plato

Quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
Author: Plato

Quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: What we repeatedly do, excellence then is not an act but a habit.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: The measure of a man is what he does with power.
Author: Plato

Quote: He who commits injustice is ever made more wretched than he who suffers it.
Author: Plato

Quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
Author: Heraclitus

Quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The only thing I know is that I know nothing.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The mind is everything; what you think, you become.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
Author: Aristotle
